outtro.p:
The given set of vectors is from the vector space
M_{2,2},
\mathcal P^3
which is isomorphic to the Euclidean vector space \mathbb R^4. Thus the problem can be solved by showing how the Euclidean vector {{e_vector}} can be constructed as a linear combination from the set {{e_set}}.
